author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of Environment Conservation Group with the rescued barn owl and red sand boa on theoutskirts of Coimbatore on Saturday.— Photo:Special Arrangement

A barn owl (Tyto alba) and a red sand boa (Eryx johnii) were rescued by members of Environment Conservation Group from two different places on Saturday.

R. Mohammed Saleem, president of Environment Conservation Group, received a call from Muthukumaran that a sand boa was sighted on his premises at Vaiyampalyam, near Kovilpalayam.

Mr. Saleem, along with V. Saanthakumar, rescued the 2.5-ft-long reptile. Red sand boa is a non-venomous snake and a friend of farmers. Sand boas are sold illegally at exorbitant rates with false claims of medicinal value.

Sathyabama from Kalappatti informed the group about the barn owl.The Barn owl was rescued and brought to forest range office. Barn Owls help in keeping the population of rats under control. Both the barn owl, and the red sand boa were handed over to the Coimbatore Forest Range office. Forest Veterinarian Dr. Manoharan examined them.
title: Barn owl, sand boa rescued
